gurmukhi: ਦੇਖ ਚਮੂੰ ਮਹਿਖਾਸੁਰੀ ਦੇਵੀ ਬਲਹਿ ਸੰਭਾਰਿ ||
transliteration: Dekh Chamoond Mahikhaasuroo Devoo Balah(i) Sanbdaar(i)||
translation: Scanning the forces of Mahishasura, the goddess pulling up her strength;

gurmukhi: ਕਛੁ ਸਿੰਘਹਿ ਕਛੁ ਚਕ੍ਰ ਸੋਂ ਡਾਰੇ ਸਭੈ ਸੰਘਾਰਿ ||੪੪||
transliteration: Kachh(u) Singhah(i) Kachh(u) Chakra Son Ddare Sabhai Sandaar(i)||44||
translation: She destroyed all, killing some thorough her lion and some with her disc.44.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਭਾਜੇ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਪੈ ਗੲੇ ਕਹਿਓ ਹਤੀ ਸਭ ਸੈਨ ||
transliteration: Ik Bhaaje Nrip Pai Gad Kahio Hatoo Sabh Sain||
translation: One of the demons ran to the king and told him about the destruction of all the army.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੳੁ ਸੁਨਿ ਕੈ ਕੋਪਿਓ ਅਸੁਰ ਚੜਿ ਅਾੲਿਓ ਰਨ ਅੈਨ ||੪੫||
transliteration: Io Soun(i) Kai Kopio Asur Chad(i) Aaio Ran Ain||45||
translation: Hearing this, Mahishasura become furious and marched towards the battlefield. 45.

gurmukhi: ਜੂਝ ਪਰੀ ਸਭ ਸੈਨ ਲਖੀ ਜਬ ਤੌ ਮਹਖਾਸੁਰ ਖੱਗ ਸੰਭਾਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Joojh Daroo Sabh Sain Lakhoo Jab Tau Mahkhaasur Khagg Sanbhaario||
translation: Knowing about the destruction of all his forces in the war, Mahishasura held up his sword.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ਕੇ ਸਾਮੁਹਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਭੲਿਅਾਨਕ ਭਾਲਕ ਜਿੳੁ ਭਭਕਾਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Channd Prachannddke Saamuh(i) Jaae Bhaiaanak Dhaalak Jio Bhabhkaario||
translation: And going before the fierce Chandi, he began to roar like dreadful bear.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਗਦਰੁ ਲੈ ਅਪਨੇ ਕਰਿ ਚੰਡ ਸੁ ਕੈਬਰਿ ਤਾ ਤਨ ੳੂਪਰਿ ਡਾਰਿਓ ||
transliteration: Mougdar(u) Lai Apne Kar(i) Channd Su Kaibar(i) Taa Tan Oopar(i) Daario||
translation: Taking his heavy mace in his hand, he threw it on body of the goddess like an arrow.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਹਨੂਮਾਨ ੳੁਖਾਰ ਪਹਾਰ ਕੋ ਰਾਵਨ ਕੇ ੳੁਰ ਭੀਤਰ ਮਾਰਿਓ ||੪੬||
transliteration: Jio Hanoomaan Oukhaar Pahaar Ko Raavan Ke Ur Bhootar Maario||46||
translation: It seemed that Hanuman carrying a hillock, threw it on the chest of Ravvana.46.

gurmukhi: ਫੇਰ ਸਰਾਸਨ ਕੋ ਗਹਿ ਕੈ ਕਰ ਬੀਰ ਹਨੇ ਤਿਨ ਪਾਨ ਨ ਮੰਗੇ ||
transliteration: Pher Saraasan Ko Gad(i) Kai Kar Boor Hane Tin Paan Na Mane||
translation: Then he held up bows and arrows in his hand , killed the warriors, who could not ask for water before dying.

gurmukhi: ਘਾੲਿਲ ਘੂਮ ਪਰੇ ਰਨ ਮਾਹਿ ਕਰਾਹਤ ਹੈ ਗਿਰ ਸੇ ਗਜ ਲੰਗੇ ||
transliteration: Ghaail Ghoom Dare Ran Maah(i) Karaahat Hai Gir Se Gad Lane||
translation: The wounded warriors were moving in the field like lame elephants.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਨ ਕੇ ਤਨ ਕੳੁਚਨ ਸਾਥਿ ਪਰੇ ਧਰ ਭਾੳੁ ੳੁਠੇ ਤਹ ਚੰਗੇ ||
transliteration: Sooran Keg An Kaouchanndsaath(i) Dare Dhar Bhaau Outhe Tah Channde||
translation: The bodies of the warriors were moving their armours were lying fried up on the ground.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਨੋ ਦਵਾ ਬਨ ਮਾਂਝ ਲਗੇ ਤਹ ਕੀਟਨ ਭੱਛ ਕੌ ਦੳੁਰੇ ਭੁਯੰਗੇ ||੪੭||
transliteration: Jaano Davaa Ban Maanjh Lage Tah Kootan Bhachchh Kau Daure Bhuyane||47||
translation: As if the forest is on fire and the snakes are running to reed themselves on the fast moving worms.47.
